--- title: Datasets keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Classes used to create `pytorch` compatible datasets." ---

class MyDataset[source]

MyDataset(items, labels, item_loader, label_loader) :: Dataset

Base class for all datasets. It is constructed using list of items and labels, most of the time as Path or str objects, with corresponding item_loader and label_loader as ItemLoader objects.

MyDataset.from_folder[source]

MyDataset.from_folder(folder, label_func, item_loader, label_loader, after_open=None, recurse=True, extensions=None, include=None, exclude=None)

Creates a MyDataset object by reading files from a folder. It uses get_item and therefore works the same.

MyDataset.to_tensor[source]

MyDataset.to_tensor(tfms=None, tfm_y=True)

Creates a TensorDataset based on this dataset.

MyDataset.split_by_list[source]

MyDataset.split_by_list(train, valid, test=None)

Creates a SplitDataset using train, valid and optionally test tuples. Each tuple contains 2 lists: one for items and one for labels.

MyDataset.split_by_folder[source]

MyDataset.split_by_folder()

Creates a SplitDataset by looking for Å§rain, valid and test in item paths and splitting the dataset accordingly.

MyDataset.split_by_csv[source]

MyDataset.split_by_csv(csv, split_column='split', id_column='scan', get_id=None)

Creates a SplitDataset by using a csv that contains an id_column column for identifying items and a split_column column that contains either 'train', 'valid' or 'test'. get_id is the function used to extract the item's id from the item itself. By default it considers that item is a Path object and takes the parent folder's name as id.

class ClassDataset[source]

ClassDataset(*args, n_classes=2, **kwargs) :: MyDataset

MyDataset subclass for classification. Stores an additionnal n_classes attribute.

class ImageClassifDataset[source]

ImageClassifDataset(*args, n_classes=2, **kwargs) :: ClassDataset

ClassDataset subclass for image classification.

ImageClassifDataset.show[source]

ImageClassifDataset.show(k, ax=None, figsize=(3, 3), hide_axis=True, cmap='viridis', **kwargs)

Shows the kth image from the dataset with the corresponding label.

ImageClassifDataset.show_rand[source]

ImageClassifDataset.show_rand(ax=None, figsize=(3, 3), hide_axis=True, cmap='viridis', **kwargs)

Shows a random image from the dataset with the corresponding label.

ImageClassifDataset.from_folder[source]

ImageClassifDataset.from_folder(folder, label_func, n_classes=None, classes=None, recurse=True, extensions=None, include=None, exclude=None, **kwargs)

Overwrites MyDataset.from_folder. Works basically the same but you don't need to pass loaders, but instead n_classes or classes arguments. Loaders are automatically created using these.

class ImageSegmentDataset[source]

ImageSegmentDataset(*args, n_classes=2, **kwargs) :: ClassDataset

ClassDataset subclass for image segmentation.

ImageSegmentDataset.show[source]

ImageSegmentDataset.show(k, ax=None, figsize=(3, 3), title=None, hide_axis=True, cmap='tab20', **kwargs)

Shows the kth image from the dataset with the corresponding mask above it.

ImageSegmentDataset.show_rand[source]

ImageSegmentDataset.show_rand(ax=None, figsize=(3, 3), hide_axis=True, cmap='tab20', **kwargs)

Shows a random image from the dataset withthe corresponding mask above it.

ImageSegmentDataset.from_folder[source]

ImageSegmentDataset.from_folder(folder, label_func, n_classes=None, classes=None, recurse=True, extensions=None, include=None, exclude=None)

Same as ImageClassifDataset.from_folder.

class NormDataset[source]

NormDataset(items, labels, item_loader, label_loader) :: MyDataset

MyDataset subclass to use for a grayscale to color unet.

NormDataset.show[source]

NormDataset.show(k, axs=None, figsize=(3, 3), title=None, hide_axis=True, cmap='viridis', **kwargs)

Shows the kth image from the dataset as grayscale and colored.

NormDataset.show_rand[source]

NormDataset.show_rand(axs=None, figsize=(3, 3), hide_axis=True, cmap='viridis', **kwargs)

Shows a random image from the dataset as grayscale and colored.

NormDataset.from_folder[source]

NormDataset.from_folder(folder, label_func, csv, id_column='scan', recurse=True, extensions=None, include=None, exclude=None)

Overwrites MyDataset.from_folder so that it doesn't need the loaders. It howevers requires a csv argument that contains an id_column column to identify images and a 'category' column that contains 1 if the image is to be used for normalization.

class SplitDataset[source]

SplitDataset(train:Dataset, valid:Dataset, test:Dataset=None)

Wrapper that contains a train, a valid and optionally a test datasets.

SplitDataset.to_tensor[source]

SplitDataset.to_tensor(tfms=None, tfm_y=True, test_tfms=None)

Transforms all datasets into TensorDataset objects

class TensorDataset[source]

TensorDataset(ds, tfms=None, tfm_y=True) :: Dataset

Wrapper around a dataset that generates tensors from the outputs of the dataset's __getitem__ method using np_to_tensor. Can also apply transforms using albumentations. Pass tfm_y=False if you don't ant to apply transforms to y (when doing classification for instance).
